question: Which two water bodies are connected by the "Baku-Tbilisi-Ceyhan Pipeline"?
explanation: Azerbaijan, Georgia and Turkey are the three countries that share the location of the "Baku-Tbilisi-Ceyhan Pipeline". The Baku–Tbilisi–Ceyhan (BTC) pipeline is a 1,768 kilometres long crude oil pipeline from the Azeri–Chirag–Gunashli oil field in the Caspian Sea to the Mediterranean Sea. It connects Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan and Ceyhan, a port on the south-eastern Mediterranean coast of Turkey, via Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. It is the second-longest oil pipeline in the former Soviet Union, after the Druzhba pipeline. The first oil that was pumped from the Baku end of the pipeline reached Ceyhan on 28 May 2006.
